snippet: Once again, the courts may need to stop the New York Police Department from illegal surveillance activities.
abstract: Editorial calls on courts to stop New York Police Department from spying on law-abiding Muslims; contends that if accusations made in court filings in long-standing suit challenging police surveillance techniques are borne out in court, judge should consider appointing independent monitor to review department techniques.
lead_paragraph: Once again, the courts may need to stop the New York Police Department from illegal surveillance activities.
